sub_title: Science Writer ✰ Biomedical Scientist ✰ Project manager
summary:
I am a science and medical writer with 9 years of experience in multiple clinical therapeutic areas and scientific fields, with a track record of writing and editing scientific publication manuscripts, training materials, grant applications, proposals, statistical analysis reports for regulatory and/or HTA review, statistical analysis plans, slide decks, abstracts and more.

Additionally, I have 11 years of research experience, including 7 years postdoctoral. In this time I have completed 6 research projects and authored 11 highly cited publications in top cardiovascular research journals. 

My motivation has always been to impact our world in a positive way and, in recent years, also to empower others to do that.

My strengths include a highly analytical mind-set, excellent problem solving, independent thinking as well as great attention to detail and organization skills. Additionally, I have experience of leadership in various organisations, as well as supervising and managing people in research projects. I thrive in dynamic international environments and love learning.

courses.name: Clinical Research Regulations in the Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Clinical Outcome Analytics (COA) team I have been:
•	Acting as lead writer on project teams.
•	Writing full statistical analysis reports of patient-reported outcomes (PRO) and psychometric analysis reports of PRO instruments used by clients for health technology assessment (HTA) and/or regulatory review.
•	Preparing dissemination materials e.g. slide decks for presentation of top line results to clients.
•	Editing, quality assurance, and formatting project-related documents developed by other project team members.  
•	Composing PRO report templates to expedite the writing process.
•	Compiling a database of projects completed by the team and the resulting publications.
•	Liaising with project team leads and project managers to ensure completion of writing and to specifications and in a timely manner.
•	Working on multiple projects to multiple deadlines simultaneously.
•	Tracking and logging hours spent on each project.
•	Working in the context of multiple clinical therapeutic areas.
•	Working to clients’ specifications and according to several style guides.
profile_positions.title: Senior Medical Writer

profile_positions.description:
As the founder and owner of ScienceQuill I take care of all administrative tasks, communication, accounting, taxes, pricing, and marketing involved in running the business, as well as:
•	Editing and/or writing manuscripts, grant proposals, book chapters, abstracts, posters, training materials, cover letters, responses to reviewers, theses and dissertations, PowerPoint presentations, articles, blog posts and more for language, grammar and structure, advice on content.
•	Creating graphical abstracts and summary figures in BioRender.
•	Working in multiple scientific fields and therapeutic areas (cardiology, vascular biology, cell and molecular biology, genetics, nephrology, surgery, physiology, oncology, science policy and others).
•	Interacting with customers for briefs and updates.
•	Incorporating customer feedback.
•	Working on several jobs/projects simultaneously.
•	Working successfully to deadlines.
profile_positions.title: Science Writer and Editor

profile_positions.description:
Investigated the molecular determinants that guide vascular smooth muscle cell phenotype switching in atherosclerosis, vascular calcification and aortic aneurysm.
•	Managed 7 research projects, 6 of which completed (planning, monitoring progress, resources, timelines & budgets, delegating tasks).
•	Designed and performing in vitro experiments.
•	Worked in ML-I and ML-II laboratories (biosafety level 1 and 2). 
•	Strictly complied with biological safety rules, regulations and documentation (GGO/GMO).
•	Wrote and published 10 scientific manuscripts.
•	Peer reviewed scientific manuscripts.
•	Edited my own and colleagues' manuscripts, theses and dissertations for language, grammar and structure.
•	Wrote grant applications.
•	Acquired research funding.
•	Researched scientific literature and writing reviews.
•	Presented results at group meeting and departmental seminars.
•	Presented results at international conferences (ISEV, IVBM, EVBO, ESC). 
•	Worked in an international team.
•	Initiated and sustained collaborations.
•	Supervised, coordinated and trained PhD, MSc and BSc students.
•	Collected data and performed statistical analysis (GraphPad Prism, Microsoft Office).
•	Documented data and results in laboratory notebooks and electronic formats. 
•	Developed and wrote protocols and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
•	Completed course on Clinical Research Regulations in the Netherlands. 
•	Involved in Green Impact, an initiative promoting sustainability. https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/green-impact-themes

profile_positions.description:
The KCL Innovation Forum was founded with the mission of bridging the gap between academia and entrepreneurship in life sciences. It has developed into a successful student organization which hosts seminars and networking events and formed a community of students and researchers interested in business.
•	Organized and hosted seminars with invited speakers from a variety of life science industry sectors.
•	Worked efficiently with a team. 
•	Raised funds for events.
•	Marketed the events within the university.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, Vice-President

profile_positions.description:
I was involved in a project exploring the effect of calcium phosphate nanocrystals on vascular smooth muscle cell survival and inflammation.
•	Collected and analysed results.
•	Wrote reports for collaborators.
•	Performed in vitro experiments.

profile_positions.description: I participated in a project looking at the function of Spt5 transcription factor in the development of Drosophila melanogaster embryos.

volunteer_experiences.description:

•	Hosted the event, including speaker introductions and ensured the smooth running of the event.
•	Liaised with the venue contacts and speakers.
